title: Get started
text: Let’s set health atlas. example use Chicago Health Atlas. can calling ha_set() Chicago Health Atlas URL. need check health atlas using, can use ha_get(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key. individual topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. Note: topics can derived multiple datasets belong multiple subcategories keywords. Therefore, columns may composed tibbles vectors. Filtering topics via pieces information still quite easy using purrr::map_lgl(). may specific topic area interested exploring. can explore topic areas using ha_subcategories(). can use subcategory_key subset list topics. topic topics mind, can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired.
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_get() #> [1] "https://chicagohealthatlas.org/api/v1/" topics <- ha_topics(progress = FALSE) topics #> # A tibble: 411 × 7 #>    topic_name             topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>    <chr>                  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #>  1 9th grade education r… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… <chr [2]>      #>  2 ACA marketplace enrol… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… <chr [5]>      #>  3 Accidents mortality    VRAC      Number of people… count of d… <chr [2]>      #>  4 Accidents mortality r… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… <chr [2]>      #>  5 Active business licen… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… <chr [1]>      #>  6 Adult asthma           HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  7 Adult asthma rate      HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  8 Adult binge drinking   HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  9 Adult binge drinking … HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults <chr [1]>      #> 10 Adult diabetes         HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… <chr [1]>      #> # ℹ 401 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list> library(dplyr) library(purrr)  # filter by dataset topics %>%   filter(map_lgl(topic_datasets, ~ "healthy-chicago-survey" %in% .x$key)) #> # A tibble: 74 × 7 #>    topic_name             topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>    <chr>                  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #>  1 Adult asthma           HCSATH    "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  2 Adult asthma rate      HCSATHP   "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  3 Adult binge drinking   HCSBD     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  4 Adult binge drinking … HCSBDP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [1]>      #>  5 Adult diabetes         HCSDIA    "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  6 Adult diabetes rate    HCSDIAP   "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [1]>      #>  7 Adult e-cigarette use  HCSEC     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  8 Adult e-cigarette use… HCSECP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  9 Adult flu vaccination  HCSFLU    "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #> 10 Adult flu vaccination… HCSFLUP   "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #> # ℹ 64 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list>  # filter by subcategory topics %>%   filter(map_lgl(topic_subcategories, ~ "diet-exercise" %in% .x$key)) #> # A tibble: 20 × 7 #>    topic_name             topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>    <chr>                  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #>  1 Adult fruit and veget… HCSFV     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  2 Adult fruit and veget… HCSFVP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  3 Adult physical inacti… HCSPA     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  4 Adult physical inacti… HCSPAP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  5 Adult soda consumption HCSS      "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  6 Adult soda consumptio… HCSSP     "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [1]>      #>  7 Easy access to fruits… HCSFVA    "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  8 Easy access to fruits… HCSFVAP   "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  9 High School fruit and… YRFV      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [2]>      #> 10 High School fruit and… YRFVP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [2]>      #> 11 High School physical … YRPA      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 12 High School physical … YRPAP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 13 High School physical … YRPI      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 14 High School physical … YRPIP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> 15 High School soda cons… YRSO      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 16 High School soda cons… YRSOP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 17 Middle School physica… YRMPA     "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 18 Middle School physica… YRMPAP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 19 Middle School physica… YRMPI     "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 20 Middle School physica… YRMPIP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list>  # filter by keyword topics %>%   filter(map_lgl(topic_keywords, ~ "activity" %in% .x)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   topic_name              topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>   <chr>                   <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #> 1 Adult physical inactiv… HCSPA     Number of adults… count of a… <chr [2]>      #> 2 Adult physical inactiv… HCSPAP    Percent of adult… % of adults <chr [2]>      #> 3 High School physical i… YRPI      Number of Chicag… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 4 High School physical i… YRPIP     Percent of Chica… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> 5 Middle School physical… YRMPI     Number of Chicag… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 6 Middle School physical… YRMPIP    Percent of Chica… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list> subcategories <- ha_subcategories() subcategories #> # A tibble: 30 × 3 #>    subcategory_name      subcategory_key       category_name        #>    <chr>                 <chr>                 <chr>                #>  1 Access to Care        access-to-care        Clinical Care        #>  2 Quality of Care       quality-of-care       Clinical Care        #>  3 Community Safety      community-safety-1    Physical Environment #>  4 Housing & Transit     housing-transit       Physical Environment #>  5 Pollution             pollution             Physical Environment #>  6 Resource Availability resource-availability Physical Environment #>  7 Behavioral Health     behavioral-health     Morbidity            #>  8 Chronic Disease       chronic-disease-1     Morbidity            #>  9 Infectious Disease    infectious-disease-1  Morbidity            #> 10 Injury & Violence     injury-violence-1     Morbidity            #> # ℹ 20 more rows ha_topics("diet-exercise") #> # A tibble: 20 × 7 #>    topic_name             topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>    <chr>                  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #>  1 Adult fruit and veget… HCSFV     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  2 Adult fruit and veget… HCSFVP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  3 Adult physical inacti… HCSPA     "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  4 Adult physical inacti… HCSPAP    "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  5 Adult soda consumption HCSS      "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  6 Adult soda consumptio… HCSSP     "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [1]>      #>  7 Easy access to fruits… HCSFVA    "Number of adult… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  8 Easy access to fruits… HCSFVAP   "Percent of adul… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  9 High School fruit and… YRFV      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [2]>      #> 10 High School fruit and… YRFVP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [2]>      #> 11 High School physical … YRPA      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 12 High School physical … YRPAP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 13 High School physical … YRPI      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 14 High School physical … YRPIP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> 15 High School soda cons… YRSO      "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 16 High School soda cons… YRSOP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 17 Middle School physica… YRMPA     "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [1]>      #> 18 Middle School physica… YRMPAP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [1]>      #> 19 Middle School physica… YRMPI     "Number of Chica… count of s… <chr [3]>      #> 20 Middle School physica… YRMPIP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… <chr [3]>      #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list> coverage <- ha_coverage("HCSFVAP", progress = FALSE) coverage #> # A tibble: 187 × 7 #>    topic_key population_key population_name population_grouping period_key #>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      #>  1 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2020-2021  #>  2 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2023-2024  #>  3 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2021-2022  #>  4 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2016-2018  #>  5 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2015-2017  #>  6 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2022-2023  #>  7 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2014-2016  #>  8 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2023-2024  #>  9 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2024       #> 10 HCSFVAP   ""             Full population ""                  2022-2023  #> # title: Get started
text: Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified . can even specify multiple topics, populations, periods get data . ha_data() return combined table data every combination topic, population, period requested. warning given every invalid combindation topic, population, period requested. want mix match topics, populations, years, layers data, recommend creating table datasets want, purrr::pmap()-ing table.
code: ease_of_access <- ha_data(   topic_key = "HCSFVAP",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2022-2023",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) ease_of_access #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-14 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  53.0          6.18 #>  2 1714000-18 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  51.0          9.56 #>  3 1714000-2  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  62.7          5.51 #>  4 1714000-43 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  46.0          6.48 #>  5 1714000-45 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  48.8         10.6  #>  6 1714000-47 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  50.4          8.55 #>  7 1714000-52 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  46.5          7.04 #>  8 1714000-6  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  66.6          2.70 #>  9 1714000-49 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  38.1          7.78 #> 10 1714000-24 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  62.3          4.19 #> # ℹ 67 more rows combinations_of_data <- ha_data(   topic_key = c("POP", "UMP"),   population_key = c("", "H"),   period_key = c("2017-2021", "2018-2022", "invalid"),   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) #> Warning: Your API call has errors. No results for topic_key = "POP" #> population_key = "" period_key = "invalid" layer_key = "neighborhood". #> Warning: Your API call has errors. No results for topic_key = "UMP" #> population_key = "" period_key = "invalid" layer_key = "neighborhood". #> Warning: Your API call has errors. No results for topic_key = "POP" #> population_key = "H" period_key = "invalid" layer_key = "neighborhood". #> Warning: Your API call has errors. No results for topic_key = "UMP" #> population_key = "H" period_key = "invalid" layer_key = "neighborhood". combinations_of_data #> # A tibble: 616 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-14 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  6.67         1.46  #>  2 1714000-18 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  5.36         2.10  #>  3 1714000-2  UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  6.66         1.11  #>  4 1714000-43 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh… 17.0          1.95  #>  5 1714000-45 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh… 13.5          5.24  #>  6 1714000-47 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh… 21.5          8.32  #>  7 1714000-52 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  8.02         1.69  #>  8 1714000-6  UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  3.86         0.580 #>  9 1714000-49 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh… 18.7          2.10  #> 10 1714000-24 UMP       ""             2017-2021  neighborh…  3.50         0.608 #> # ℹ 606 more rows library(tibble) library(purrr)  # creating a table of data I want metadata <- tribble(   ~topic_key,   ~population_key,   ~period_key,   ~layer_key,   "POP",   "",   "2017-2021",   "neighborhood",   "HCSFVAP",   "",   "2020-2021",   "neighborhood",   "UMP",   "H",   "2017-2021",   "neighborhood", )  metadata %>%   pmap(ha_data) #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl> <lgl>         #>  1 1714000-35 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 21276. NA            #>  2 1714000-36 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor…  7417. NA            #>  3 1714000-37 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor…  2280. NA            #>  4 1714000-38 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 24397. NA            #>  5 1714000-39 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 18503. NA            #>  6 1714000-4  POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 42252. NA            #>  7 1714000-40 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 11608. NA            #>  8 1714000-41 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 28802. NA            #>  9 1714000-42 POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 24362. NA            #> 10 1714000-1  POP       ""             2017-2021  neighbor… 55627. NA            #> # ℹ 67 more rows #>  #> [[2]] #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-14 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  59.6          7.18 #>  2 1714000-18 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  46.3          9.32 #>  3 1714000-2  HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  61.8          5.95 #>  4 1714000-43 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  58.5          6.90 #>  5 1714000-45 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  55.7         10.4  #>  6 1714000-47 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  19.0          7.30 #>  7 1714000-52 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  49.0         11.8  #>  8 1714000-6  HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  77.5          2.31 #>  9 1714000-49 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  54.9          7.55 #> 10 1714000-24 HCSFVAP   ""             2020-2021  neighborh…  76.1          3.17 #> # ℹ 67 more rows #>  #> [[3]] #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid     topic_key population_key period_key layer_key   value standardError #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>       <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor… 20.2            22.8  #>  2 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  0.0239         48.0  #>  3 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  6.60           21.8  #>  4 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  9.47           30.5  #>  5 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor… 12.2            28.4  #>  6 1714000-4 UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  8.13            3.35 #>  7 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor… 29.8            52.9  #>  8 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  6.42           10.5  #>  9 1714000-… UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  3.37           37.6  #> 10 1714000-1 UMP       H              2017-2021  neighbor…  5.19            4.38 #> # title: Get started
text: can see geographic layers available using ha_layers(). Since just downloaded data Community Area level, let’s import Community Area geographic layer ha_layer(). can also set geometry = TRUE within data call get geographic layer’s geometry along data. Let’s map data!  map looks pretty good, perhaps point layer may provide insight spatial variation ease access fruits vegetables. can use ha_point_layers() list point layers available Chicago Health Atlas. Grocery store locations may important aspect ease access fruits vegetables. can import layer providing point_layer_uuid ha_point_layer(). Now imported grocery stores, let’s layer top map.  expected, seems areas grocery stores tend higher percent adults report easy get fresh fruits vegetables. typical use case healthatlas explored every function healthatlas offer. Now ’s time explore!
code: layers <- ha_layers() layers #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   layer_name      layer_key    layer_description                       layer_url #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>                                   <chr>     #> 1 Community areas neighborhood The city of Chicago is divided into 77… https://… #> 2 ZIP Codes       zip          The ZIP code is a basic unit of geogra… https://… #> 3 Census Tracts   tract-2020   Census tracts are small geographies de… https://… #> 4 Chicago         place        Cities, towns, villages, and boroughs,… https://… community_areas <- ha_layer("neighborhood") community_areas #> Simple feature collection with 77 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.94011 ymin: 41.64454 xmax: -87.52419 ymax: 42.02305 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> First 10 features: #>         geoid    layer_key                         name population state #> 1   1714000-1 neighborhood    Rogers Park (Chicago, IL)      55454    IL #> 2  1714000-10 neighborhood   Norwood Park (Chicago, IL)      41069    IL #> 3  1714000-11 neighborhood Jefferson Park (Chicago, IL)      26201    IL #> 4  1714000-12 neighborhood    Forest Glen (Chicago, IL)      19579    IL #> 5  1714000-13 neighborhood     North Park (Chicago, IL)      17522    IL #> 6  1714000-14 neighborhood    Albany Park (Chicago, IL)      48549    IL #> 7  1714000-15 neighborhood   Portage Park (Chicago, IL)      63038    IL #> 8  1714000-16 neighborhood    Irving Park (Chicago, IL)      51911    IL #> 9  1714000-17 neighborhood        Dunning (Chicago, IL)      43120    IL #> 10 1714000-18 neighborhood      Montclare (Chicago, IL)      14412    IL #>             notes                       geometry #> 1  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.65456 4... #> 2  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.78002 4... #> 3  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.75264 4... #> 4  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.72642 4... #> 5  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.7069 41... #> 6  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.70404 4... #> 7  Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.75264 4... #> 8  Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.69475 4... #> 9 them to\nget fresh fruits and vegetables."   ) +   theme_minimal() plot point_layers <- ha_point_layers() point_layers #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    point_layer_name what: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Explore Import Metopio Powered Health Atlases. Metopio helps many public health departments build curated data platforms. data platforms convenient way community members researchers explore download public health data. spirit mind, package aims make interfacing data portals within R painless reproducible. Note: unofficial R wrapper Metopio Health Atlases. package way affiliated Metopio public health departments Metopio serves. Examples Metopio health atlases include: Chicago Health Atlas: https://chicagohealthatlas.org/ Cook County Health Atlas: https://cookcountyhealthatlas.org/ University Illinois Cancer Center Data Hub: https://uicc.metop.io/ Idaho Oregon Community Health Atlas: https://idahooregoncommunityhealthatlas.org/ Northern Kentucky Atlas: https://atlas.northernkentuckyusa.com/ Allen County Health Atlas: https://allencountyhealthatlas.org/ Kane County Health Atlas: https://kanehealthatlas.org/ Contra Costa Health Atlas: https://atlas.cchealth.org/

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: can install healthatlas CRAN. , can install development version healthatlas R-universe :
code: install.packages("healthatlas") install.packages("healthatlas", repos = c("https://ryanzomorrodi.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Set health atlas. example, going use Chicago Health Atlas, can , providing Chicago Health Atlas URL ha_set(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. , can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired. Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified . Let’s create map. first, need download Community Areas geographic layer. can ha_layer(). Now can make map!
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_topics(progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 411 × 7 #>    topic_name             topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>    <chr>                  <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #>  1 9th grade education r… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… <chr [2]>      #>  2 ACA marketplace enrol… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… <chr [5]>      #>  3 Accidents mortality    VRAC      Number of people… count of d… <chr [2]>      #>  4 Accidents mortality r… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… <chr [2]>      #>  5 Active business licen… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… <chr [1]>      #>  6 Adult asthma           HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… <chr [2]>      #>  7 Adult asthma rate      HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults <chr [2]>      #>  8 Adult binge drinking   HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… <chr [1]>      #>  9 Adult binge drinking … HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults <chr [1]>      #> 10 Adult diabetes         HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… <chr [1]>      #> # ℹ 401 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list> ha_coverage("EDA", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 156 × 7 #>    topic_key population_key population_name population_grouping period_key #>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      #>  1 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2011-2015  #>  2 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2007-2011  #>  3 EDA       "F"            Female          "Sex"               2016-2020  #>  4 EDA       "F"            Female          "Sex"               2015-2019  #>  5 EDA       "F"            Female          "Sex"               2014-2018  #>  6 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2009-2013  #>  7 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2018-2022  #>  8 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2017-2021  #>  9 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2006-2010  #> 10 EDA       ""             Full population ""                  2015-2019  #> # ℹ 146 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: layer_key <chr>, layer_name <chr> data <- ha_data(   topic_key = "EDA",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2018-2022",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) data #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-35 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.1          4.64 #>  2 1714000-36 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  98.5          4.64 #>  3 1714000-37 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.0          6.93 #>  4 1714000-38 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  97.0          4.69 #>  5 1714000-39 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  98.4          7.34 #>  6 1714000-4  EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.1          3.18 #>  7 1714000-40 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  97.5          6.86 #>  8 1714000-41 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  99.0          5.27 #>  9 1714000-42 EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  96.3          3.63 #> 10 1714000-1  EDA       ""             2018-2022  neighborh…  93.9          2.72 #> # ℹ 67 more rows layer <- ha_layer(   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) layer #> Simple feature collection with 77 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.94011 ymin: 41.64454 xmax: -87.52419 ymax: 42.02305 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> First 10 features: #>         geoid    layer_key                         name population state #> 1   1714000-1 neighborhood    Rogers Park (Chicago, IL)      55454    IL #> 2  1714000-10 neighborhood   Norwood Park (Chicago, IL)      41069    IL #> 3  1714000-11 neighborhood Jefferson Park (Chicago, IL)      26201    IL #> 4  1714000-12 neighborhood    Forest Glen (Chicago, IL)      19579    IL #> 5  1714000-13 neighborhood     North Park (Chicago, IL)      17522    IL #> 6  1714000-14 neighborhood    Albany Park (Chicago, IL)      48549    IL #> 7  1714000-15 neighborhood   Portage Park (Chicago, IL)      63038    IL #> 8  1714000-16 neighborhood    Irving Park (Chicago, IL)      51911    IL #> 9  1714000-17 neighborhood        Dunning (Chicago, IL)      43120    IL #> 10 1714000-18 neighborhood      Montclare (Chicago, IL)      14412    IL #>             notes                       geometry #> 1  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.65456 4... #> 2  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.78002 4... #> 3  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.75264 4... #> 4  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.72642 4... #> 5  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.7069 41... #> 6  Far North Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.70404 4... #> 7  Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.75264 4... #> 8  Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.69475 4... #> 9  Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.77621 4... #> 10 Northwest Side MULTIPOLYGON (((-87.78942 4... library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  map_data <- layer |>   left_join(data, "geoid")   ggplot(map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), alpha = 0.7) +   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "GnBu", direction = 1) +   labs(     title = "9th Grade Education Rate",     fill = ""   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: List combinations population, periods, geographic layers available given topic. search individual topics use ha_topics().

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
code: ha_coverage(topic_key, layer_key = NULL, keys_only = FALSE, progress = TRUE)

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: topic_key Unique ID specifying topic. layer_key Character string vector Unique IDs geographic layers. keys_only Return keys? progress Display progress bar?

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: Topic coverage tibble.

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_coverage("POP", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1,987 × 7 #>    topic_key population_key population_name       population_grouping period_key #>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>                 <chr>               <chr>      #>  1 POP       H              Hispanic or Latino    Race/Ethnicity      2012-2016  #>  2 POP       WY             Non-Hispanic White, … Race/Ethnicity and… 2018-2022  #>  3 POP       HS             Hispanic or Latino, … Race/Ethnicity and… 2015-2019  #>  4 POP       PM             Native American, Mal… Race/Ethnicity and… 2016-2020  #>  5 POP       BM             Non-Hispanic Black, … Race/Ethnicity and… 2019-2023  #>  6 POP       FO             Females, Middle-Aged… Sex and Age         2014-2018  #>  7 POP       A              Asian                 Race/Ethnicity      2019-2023  #>  8 POP       H              Hispanic or Latino    Race/Ethnicity      2013-2017  #>  9 POP       HF             Hispanic or Latino, … Race/Ethnicity and… 2016-2020  #> 10 POP       B              Non-Hispanic Black    Race/Ethnicity      2019-2023  #> # ℹ 1,977 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: layer_key <chr>, layer_name <chr> # }

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Obtain data one topics within specified populations specified time periods geographic scale. combinations topic, population, period, layer returned. Warnings generated invalid combinations.

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
code: ha_data(   topic_key,   population_key,   period_key,   layer_key,   geometry = FALSE,   progress = TRUE )

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: topic_key Character string vector Unique IDs(s) specifying topic(s). population_key Character string vector Unique ID(s) population stratification(s). period_key Character string vector Unique ID(s) time period(s). layer_key Character string specifying Unique ID geographic layer. geometry Attach geometry output? progress Display progress bar?

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Data tibble containing value standard error topic measure.

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_data("POP", "H", "2014-2018", "zip") #> # A tibble: 58 × 7 #>    geoid topic_key population_key period_key layer_key value standardError #>    <chr> <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>     <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 60601 POP       H              2014-2018  zip        1274         234.  #>  2 60602 POP       H              2014-2018  zip          81          48.0 #>  3 60603 POP       H              2014-2018  zip         115          86.3 #>  4 60604 POP       H              2014-2018  zip          34          16.4 #>  5 60605 POP       H              2014-2018  zip        1608         262.  #>  6 60606 POP       H              2014-2018  zip         195          74.8 #>  7 60607 POP       H              2014-2018  zip        2457         278.  #>  8 60608 POP       H              2014-2018  zip       40146        1326.  #>  9 60609 POP       H              2014-2018  zip       32860         880.  #> 10 60610 POP       H              2014-2018  zip        2601         269.  #> # ℹ 48 more rows # }

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
text: Get health atlas currently connected .

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
code: ha_get()

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
text: Current value ha_URL environment variable.

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_get() #> [1] "https://chicagohealthatlas.org/api/v1/" # }

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
text: Import geographic layer sf object.

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
code: ha_layer(layer_key, progress = TRUE)

title: Obtain Geographic Layer — ha_layer
text: layer_key Unique ID geographic layer. progress Display progress bar?

text: sf geographic layer.

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
text: Set health atlas connect .

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
code: ha_set(ha_URL)

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
text: ha_URL URL health atlas home page.

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
text: return value. Sets ha_URL environment variable.

title: Set Health Atlas Portal — ha_set
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") # }

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
text: List topic subcategories, can used filter topics within ha_topics().

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
code: ha_subcategories()

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
text: Topic subcategory tibble.

title: List Topic Subcategories — ha_subcategories
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_subcategories() #> # A tibble: 30 × 3 #>    subcategory_name      subcategory_key       category_name        #>    <chr>                 <chr>                 <chr>                #>  1 Access to Care        access-to-care        Clinical Care        #>  2 Quality of Care       quality-of-care       Clinical Care        #>  3 Community Safety      community-safety-1    Physical Environment #>  4 Housing & Transit     housing-transit       Physical Environment #>  5 Pollution             pollution             Physical Environment #>  6 Resource Availability resource-availability Physical Environment #>  7 Behavioral Health     behavioral-health     Morbidity            #>  8 Chronic Disease       chronic-disease-1     Morbidity            #>  9 Infectious Disease    infectious-disease-1  Morbidity            #> 10 Injury & Violence     injury-violence-1     Morbidity            #> # ℹ 20 more rows # }

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: List topics available descriptions units.

title: List Topics — ha_topics
code: ha_topics(subcategory_key = NULL, progress = TRUE)

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: subcategory_key Unique id topic subcategory progress Display progress bar?

title: List Topics — ha_topics
text: Topics information tibble.

title: List Topics — ha_topics
code: # \donttest{ ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_topics("education", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   topic_name              topic_key topic_description topic_units topic_keywords #>   <chr>                   <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <list>         #> 1 9th grade education ra… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… <chr [2]>      #> 2 Arts Education Access … CHAVBTN   The number of CP… Count of C… <chr [4]>      #> 3 Arts Education Access … CHACSJY   The percent of C… Percent of… <chr [4]>      #> 4 College graduation rate EDE       Residents 25 or … % of resid… <chr [1]>      #> 5 High school graduation… EDB       Residents 25 or … % of resid… <chr [1]>      #> 6 Preschool enrollment    EDG       Percentage of 3-… % of toddl… <chr [3]>      #> # ℹ 2 more variables: topic_datasets <list>, topic_subcategories <list> # }

title: healthatlas (development version)
text: Started mocking requests reduce CRAN issues.

title: healthatlas 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-05-01 Empty lists within point objects longer cause errors within ha_point_layer().

title: healthatlas 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-01 Datasets keywords added ha_topics() results. Additionally, multiple subcategories now viewable. (#5). API page limit raised, resulting faster queries (#7). Requests now cached (#9).

title: healthatlas 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-18 dplyr, tidyr, purrr dependencies removed (#2). chks introduced ensure type checking provide consistent error syntax. ha_get() now returns NA health atlas set.

title: healthatlas 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-09-13 Initial Release
